intro: Phloeophila hystrix, commonly known as the spiked phloeophila, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
